Problems about vaccinations - Online Doctor Chats

Date : 21-Feb-2012
User rating for this question
Very Good Posted in: Vaccinations
Answered by
Dr. Yogesh D
General & Family Physician
Practicing since : 2009
Answered : 595 Questions
Ask me a Question »
User :   Dear User, You have started the trial chat with our doctor. This chat is only to provide you an idea how an actual chat would be like. Please note that the time of this chat is insufficient for the doctors to provide you a detailed answer to your questions. After the trial period, you will be redirected to the Payment page and you can select a package of your choice.
User :   1. Do you recommend vaccinations? Why or why not? 2. What is the purpose for vaccinations? 3. How do vaccinations work? 4. Can vaccinations cause autism in children? Why or why not? 5. If people do not get vaccinated can it bring back diseases that have one been wiped out? Why or why not? 6. Should parents be required to get their children vaccinated? Why or why not?
Doctor :   Hi,
User :   hi can you please anser those questions
Doctor :   yes, vaccines are recommended, they provide active immunity
Doctor :   they are given to develop immunity against the specific organism
Doctor :   a vaccine contains eithr a live attenuated , dead or even structural parts of the organism which will stimulate our immune system tp produce antibodies which stay in life long and provide resistance to the organism
Doctor :   no , vaccines do not cause autism
Doctor :   because there is no recorded event and not related
Doctor :   yes, parents shuld take care that the child gets vaccinated according to the universal schedule
